compositeCheatsheet.name: End-to-end scenario: Importing SAP tables and generate extraction jobs

taskGroup.name: Importing SAP tables and generate extraction jobs
taskGroup.intro: This cheat sheet will guide you end-to-end through the process of importing logical tables from SAP into a logical data model, transform the logical data model into a physical data model, creating a database from the physical model, and, finally, generating a DataStage job that will extract the SAP table to the created database.
taskGroup.onCompletion: You have now created a logical data model containing SAP metadata, a database that can hold SAP data, and jobs that are able to extract data from SAP to this database.

task.name: Importing logical tables from SAP
task.intro: This task will guide you through creating a logical data model and importing the metadata of SAP logical tables into this model.

task.name: Prepare the logical data model for job generation
task.intro: This task will guide you through preparing the logical data model created previously for Rapid Generator for SAP. This will involve transforming it into a physical data model and create the database of the physical model.

task.name: Generating jobs with Rapid Generator for SAP
task.intro: This task will show you how to generate jobs from the physical model created previously. These jobs will use the created database to hold SAP data.
